message.content:
{"id": "3622", 
 "title": "Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has a confusing message", 
 "description": "When invoking the 'New Java Package' wizard, a confusing message appears at the top of the wizard before any input is provided in the package name field. The message states, 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. This message is unclear and ambiguous. It is not clear whether this message indicates an error or a warning. Additionally, the message should be displayed in red with an error icon if it is indeed an error. The package name field is initially empty when this message appears. It is important to clarify the meaning and purpose of this message and ensure it is displayed appropriately.

Notes:
- EG (5/1/2001 5:53:41 AM): There should be no error message when the package name field is empty, and the 'Finish' button should be disabled.
- MA (5/2/01 9:34:00 AM): It is a warning. I will remove the message.
- EG (5/2/01 9:43:44 AM): The issue is how to create a default package. Currently, it can't be created by the user since it is always present.", 
 "OB": "When invoking the 'New Java Package' wizard, a message indicating that a folder corresponding to the package name already exists appears at the top of the wizard, even when the package name field is empty.", 
 "EB": "The 'New Java Package' wizard should not display a message stating that a folder corresponding to the package name already exists if the package name field is empty. If the message is necessary, it should be clearly defined whether it is an error or a warning, and should be displayed in red with an appropriate icon. Additionally, a mechanism should be added to allow users to create a default package.", 
 "SR": "1. Remove the display of the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' when the package name field is empty in the 'New Java Package' wizard.
2. If the message is necessary, clarify whether it is an error or a warning. Display it in red with an appropriate icon if it is an error.
3. Add functionality to allow users to create a default package in the 'New Java Package' wizard."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '3622', 'title': 'Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)', 'description': 'Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O) ', 'OB': 'Invoke New Java Package.Result: Before you type anything the following message appears at the top: "A foldercorresponding to the package name already exists".At this point my package name fieldis empty.What does this message mean?Is this an error?If so, should it be displayed inred with the error icon?NOTES:EG (5/1/2001 5:53:41 AM)there should be no error message when the package name field is empty andfinish should be disabled.MA (5/2/01 9:34:00 AM)It is a warning.I will remove the messageEG (5/2/01 9:43:44 AM)issue how to create a default package?It can\'t be created by the user since it always there. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
